newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH BANK HANDLOWY EYES EUROBOND AT TURN Q1-Q2.
newsitem.headline: POLISH BANK HANDLOWY EYES EUROBOND AT TURN Q1-Q2.

text.p: Polish Bank Handlowy SA's planned up-to-$200-million, dollar-eurobond issue to be led by JP Morgan will take place at the start of April at the latest, a senior Handlowy official said on Monday.
"The issue will be at the turn of the first and second quarters...at the latest at the beginning of April," Wlodzimierz Kasprzak, a Handlowy department head, told Reuters.
The bank has said the bonds would likely have a maturity of three or five years and that the issue would not be smaller than $100 million.
It has said the issue's proceeds would be used for the bank's operational activities and that the size would be tailored to Handlowy's specific needs.
Kasprzak said Handlowy would soon announce further details of the issue, including its pricing range.
Handlowy, Poland's leading commercial bank, is earmarked for privatisation this year with about 30 percent of shares set aside for an initial public offering in June.
The bank also plans to offer 30 percent of shares to a group of international financial institutions.
In 1996 Handlowy issued Poland's first-ever corporate $100 million eurobond and was awarded a Baa3 rating by Moody's.
